column1: fp2_yearly.1001.desc0:"After winning another game of chess against myself
column2: I can't help but think that perhaps my towering intellect could improve this game somewhat. \n\nBut what change would make the most sense?"

column1: fp2_yearly.1001.a0:"The King is clearly too weak."
fp2_yearly.1001.c0:"Why can't I torture the pawns?"
fp2_yearly.1002.desc0:"Late at night I hear strange sounds coming from a room down the hall. Upon peeking round the door I can see my [ROOT.Char.Custom2('RelationToMeShort'
column3: bound and being beaten with a wooden rod by a servant
column4: who appears to be dressed in some of my old clothes. If that weren't strange enough
column5: [deviant_courtier.GetSheHe] seems to be loving it.\n\nBetween hits [deviant_courtier.GetSheHe] shouts out Yes! Punish me [ROOT.GetCharacter.GetNameNoTooltip]

column1: fp2_yearly.1003.desc0:"A commotion in my courtyard catches my attention as [injured_knight.Custom2('MyCharacterIntroduction'
column2: ROOT.Char)] is carried in by several peasants. [injured_knight.GetSheHe|U] is obviously badly injured.\n\nWhen I demand to know what happened
column3: the peasants tell me they found [injured_knight.GetHerHim] in a field where [injured_knight.GetSheHe] claimed to have just barely fought off a giant.\n\nHis squire pulls me aside after the story is over
column4: The truth is that [injured_knight.GetSheHe] tried to joust with a windmill and lost my lord
column5: but these villagers seems quite taken with [injured_knight.GetHerHis] story."""""

column1: fp2_yearly.1003.b0:"I'll brook no fairy tales in my court."
fp2_yearly.1004.desc0:"I am reading a history of [hawk_of_quraysh.GetName] also known as The Hawk of Quarysh"".\n\nLearning about his life is incredibly inspiring
column3: to establishing the [hawk_dynasty.GetName] dynasty in Iberia
column4: I can't help but think I should take some of it to heart."""

column1: fp2_yearly.1004.a0:"I too could inspire my men as he did at Carmona."
fp2_yearly.1004.b0:"His diplomatic dealings with the Yemeni are legendary."
fp2_hawk_of_quarysh_martial_modifier_desc0:"This character has gained martial inspiration from the Hawk of Quarysh."
fp2_hawk_of_quarysh_diplomacy_modifier_desc0:"This character has gained diplomatic inspiration from the Hawk of Quarysh."

column2: a large [hidden_viking.GetWomanMan] is dragged before me. [hidden_viking.GetSheHe|U] is clearly a viking raider
column3:
the type who has sown chaos in our realm for decades.

Please have mercy. My name is [hidden_viking.GetName] and I've been living in [viking_county.GetNameNoTooltip] for years. I was left behind because I was injured. The villagers saved me; they're my family now.""

The viking falls to his knees
column4: hoping I'll spare [hidden_viking.GetHerHis] life. Several peasants confirm [hidden_viking.GetHerHis] story."""

column1: fp2_yearly.1005.a0:"You may entertain my courtiers with your unique story."
fp2_yearly.1005.b0:"A good act doesn't balance out the bad — you die."
fp2_yearly.1006.desc0:"I stop at a roadside stall selling some simple foods. The trader
column3: plies me with different wares before reaching below the stall and bringing out a carved wooden box.\n\nFor you my liege
column4: this is the finest cheese in all the realm. [cheese_trader.GetSheHe|U] pushes the small block into my hand
column6: ""It was crafted by cheese-making Vikings here in Iberia.""\n\nDespite the bizarre comment

column1: fp2_yearly.1006.a0:"I'll accept your cheese but not your ridiculous story."
fp2_yearly.1006.b0:"I must find these Cheese Vikings""..."""
fp2.1006.b.tt0:"You send your agents out to find the Cheese Vikings"""""
fp2_yearly.1007.desc0:"A scrawny looking [fake_cheese_viking.GetWomanMan] is brought before me. However
column2: the pathetic [fake_cheese_viking.GetWomanMan] in front of me barely looks like a cheese maker — let alone a Viking.\n\nI'm truly sorry
column3: but I'm not really a Viking. It's just a lie to help with selling the cheese

column2: at least I solved the mystery."

column1: fp2_respected_clergy_chess_desc0:"Changed the rules of chess to respect the clergy."

column2: this cheese was not made by Vikings. However it is extremely good."

column1: fp2_yearly.1008.desc0:"It is time. Deep in my cellar has sat some of the most incredible cheese in the known world
column3: increasing in potency.\n\n And now I shall consume it."
